</span></h2>

<h2><a name="_Goal:"></a><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:red'>Goal:</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
color:black'>The goal of this class is to familiarize you with the basic
principles of artificial intelligence. You will l</span><span style='font-size:
12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>earn <span style='color:black'>some
</span>basic AI techniques, the problems for which they are applicable, and
their limitations.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>The
course content is organized roughly around what are often considered to be
three central pillars of AI: Search, Logic, and Learning. Topics covered
include basic search, heuristic search, game search, constraint satisfaction,
knowledge representation, logic and inference, probabilistic modeling, and
machine learning algorithms. <o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<h2><a name="_Class_Setup:"></a><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:red'>Class Setup:</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>The
course will be primarily lecture-based.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>There will be a Mid-term and a Final Exam.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>On every other Thursdays before the
Mid-term Exam, and every other Tuesday after it, the first 20 minutes will be
an in-class pop quiz, followed by lecture (see specific dates in <a
href="#_Syllabus_Overview_and">Syllabus Overview</a> ).<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>The frequent quizzes are intended to
encourage you to stay current with the course material.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span><u>All exams and quizzes may cover all
material presented in class, including lectures and assigned textbook reading.</u><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Quizzes will cover mostly material
presented since the last quiz, and also may include questions that many
students missed on the previous quiz.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>The Final Exam will cover mostly material since the Mid-term Exam, and
also will include many questions intended to encourage you to remember the
earlier material (i.e., the Final Exam <u>will </u>be comprehensive). <u>Please
study the previous CS-171 quizzes and exams (<a href="#_Study_Guides_---">below</a>),
which are made available as study guides to help you learn and master the class
material; they are important guides about the performance that will be expected
from you now.</u> <o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p> </o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Homework
will be assigned, but is not graded. The reason is that prior student course
evaluations alerted me to the existence of student cheating by way of copying
the homework answers.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>I deplore
this degree of personal degradation in dishonest students, but I cannot control
it, and so I avoid the opportunity.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>I remain determined to create a fair and honest educational experience
for all students, as best I can.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>There
will be an AI coding project (see <a href="#_Projects:">Project section</a>
below).<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>This is an individual or
pair project, i.e., you must do it entirely by yourself or form a team of two
people. <o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>Sometimes teams do not work out.</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Any team member may dissolve their team
at any time by so notifying the Instructor, TAs, and Tournament Director. Any
code written before the dissolution is “community property” which
may be used freely by both former team members. Any code written after the
dissolution is the sole property of the person who wrote it.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Please
note that you are encouraged to discuss concepts, methods, algorithms, etc.;
but <span style='background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>you are forbidden to
copy:</span> (1) source code from any source, or (2) text from any source
unless properly cited and set off as a quote.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span><span style='background:yellow;
mso-highlight:yellow'>Except for class materials provided from this class
website, you or your team must invent and write all of your own code by
yourself.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Except for properly
referenced material, you or your team must write all of your own project report
by yourself.</span><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>Please note that your source code and
project report are subject to analysis by automated plagiarism detection
programs, and that direct copying will be treated as an act of academic
dishonesty (please see the section on “<a href="#_Academic_Honesty:">Academic
Honesty</a>” below).<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>Please start your AI coding project
earlier than you believe necessary, i.e., immediately; it will take longer and
be more difficult than you expect </span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";background:red;mso-highlight:red'>(<u>as
is true of all coding projects everywhere at all times</u>).</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>All
the various CS-171 AI project shells were written by former CS-171 students who
became interested in AI and signed up for CS-199 in order to pursue their
interest and write more interesting AI project shells.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Please let me know if this is of
interest to you (CS-171 grade of A- or better required).<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:black'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=left>

</span></h2>

<h2><a name="_Textbook"></a><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:red'>Textbook</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
color:red'>Required:</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:black'><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span><a
href="http://aima.cs.berkeley.edu/">Russell & <span class=SpellE><span
class=GramE>Norvig</span></span><span class=GramE> :</span> Artificial
Intelligence; A Modern Approach, 3<sup>rd</sup> edition.</a><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<p><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'>The
course is based on, and the UCI bookstore has, the 3<sup>rd</sup> edition. The assigned
textbook reading is required, and is fair game for quizzes and exams.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span></span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:red'>You
place yourself at a distinct disadvantage if you do not have the textbook.</span></b><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>I expect that you have a personal copy
of the textbook, and quizzes and exams are written accordingly.</span></b><span
style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'>Please
purchase or rent your own personal textbook for the quarter (and then resell it
back to the UCI Bookstore at the end if you don't want it for reference).</span>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u><span style='color:red'>Please do not
jeopardize your precious educational experience with the false economy of trying
to save a few dollars by not having a personal copy of the textbook.</span></u></b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'>Also,
for your convenience, I have requested that a copy of the textbook be placed on
reserve in the UCI Science Library.</span><strong><span style='font-weight:
normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'> There is a two-hour check-out limit. </span></strong>However,
please understand that with high student enrollments, it is unrealistic to
expect that these thin reserves always will be available when you need
them.  <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u><span style='color:red'>Please
purchase or rent your own personal textbook. Otherwise, you are at a severe
disadvantage.</span></u></b><strong><span style='color:red;font-weight:normal;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p></o:p></span></strong></p>

<p><strong><span style='background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow;font-weight:
normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>I do deplore the high cost of modern

style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>One bonus point is equivalent to one

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><a name="_Study_Habits:"></a><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:red'>Study Habits:</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p> </o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>This course is technical, rigorous,
and demanding. You will be expected to learn and master a large body of
technical material in a very short period of time. You must demonstrate your
mastery by (1) accurate performance on frequent quizzes and exams, and (2)
successful implementation of an AI coding project.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>I
deliberately treat you as adults who are responsible for your own educational
decisions, and so Lecture is optional. <span style='background:yellow;
mso-highlight:yellow'>Discussion Section is required and roll will be taken,</span>
because it is part of our educational mission to train our TAs to become future
professors. Nevertheless, students who do not attend Lecture are at a serious
disadvantage and do not succeed as well in this class.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Students who spend Lectures and
Discussion Section sleeping, on cell phones, surfing the Web, or on social
media are wasting their time and might as well be absent.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Such students send me email messages to
ask questions that already were covered thoroughly and in detail during Lecture
and once again in Discussion Section.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>On quizzes and exams, they miss points that already have been covered
thoroughly.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><u><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Your
educational moments are precious, and your education now will be the single
most important factor in your future career success or failure.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Please, make the most of your precious
educational moments now. Please, attend both Lecture and Discussion Section,
pay attention, ask questions, and master the material.</span></u><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Please
do not ever fall behind in the class material; instead, <u>study frequently and
diligently</u>. Please begin your AI coding project earlier than you believe
necessary; it will take longer and be more difficult than you expect (<u>as is
true of all coding projects everywhere at all times</u>).<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Please
work harder and study longer.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>Please understand thoroughly all class material, and ask questions when
you do not understand.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Please
attend all lectures and discussion sections.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Please come to lectures and discussion
sections prepared with questions about any material that is not clear.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Please do all assigned reading, both
before and again after lecture. Please review the lecture notes, several times
over, both before and again after lecture, until you understand every detail.
Please regularly attend office hours with me and the TA. Please ask questions
about any class material that is not absolutely crystal clear.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Please
<u>work and understand all past quizzes and exams; they are important guides
about the performance that will be expected from you now.</u> Please work and
understand all the optional homework.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Please
<u>OVERSTUDY!!</u> <o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><a name="_Syllabus:"></a><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:red'>Syllabus:</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<p><b>The following represents a preliminary syllabus. Some changes in the
lecture sequence may occur due to earthquakes, fires, floods, wars, natural
disasters, unnatural disasters, or the discretion of the instructor based on
class progress.<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p><b>Background Reading and Lecture Slides will be changed or revised as the
class progresses at the discretion of the instructor.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Please note:<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>I often tweak or revise the lecture
slides prior to or after the lecture; please ensure that you have the current
version.<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p><b>Please read the assigned textbook reading and review the lecture notes <span
style='color:red'>in advance </span>of each lecture, then <span
style='color:red'>again after </span>each lecture.<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:.5in'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt'><span
style='mso-tab-count:2'>                        </span></span><span
class=GramE><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>“<a
href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Technological_singularity">Technological
singularity</a>” --- Wikipedia.</span></span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:1.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-1.5in'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>                                    </span>“The
technological singularity hypothesis is that accelerating progress in
technologies will cause a runaway effect wherein artificial intelligence will exceed
human intellectual capacity and control, thus radically changing or even ending
civilization in an event called the singularity.”<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span style='mso-tab-count:2'>                        </span><span
class=GramE>“<a
href="http://www-rohan.sdsu.edu/faculty/vinge/misc/singularity.html">The Coming
Technological Singularity: How to Survive in the Post-Human Era</a>” (c)
1993 by <span class=SpellE>Vernor</span> <span class=SpellE>Vinge</span>.</span><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span style='mso-tab-count:3'>                                    </span>(Verbatim
copying/translation and distribution of this entire article <span class=GramE>is</span>
permitted in any medium, provided this notice is preserved.)<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>    </span><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:1.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-1.5in'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span style='mso-tab-count:2'>                                                </span>“Abstract:<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>     </span>Within thirty years,
we will have the technological means to create superhuman intelligence. Shortly
after, the human era will be ended.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>Is such progress avoidable? If not to be avoided, can events be guided
so that we may survive?<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>These
questions are investigated. Some possible answers (and some further dangers)
are presented.”<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:1.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-1.5in'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span style='mso-tab-count:2'>                                                </span>“....
Just so I'm not guilty of a relative-time ambiguity, let me more specific: I'll
be surprised if this event occurs before 2005 or after 2030....”<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span style='mso-tab-count:2'>                        </span><span
class=GramE>Rumors,</span> and rumors of rumors.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Skeptics, including me, point out that
the design-implement-test-debug loop includes a necessarily slow
implement-test-debug step that cannot, at least in the foreseeable future, be
reduced by faster computation. On the other hand, perhaps in the unforeseeable future
fast and perfect computational simulation could eliminate that slow
implement-test-debug step? <u>You be the judge.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>;-)</u><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
color:black'><o:p> </o:p></span></b></p>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";color:black'><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>                       
</span><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>Dr.
<span class=SpellE>Trumbauer</span> comments, “One thing to possibly
discuss with the last slide is that the itinerary it settles on does stay at a
higher energy for a little bit until it passes closest to Europa, maximizing
the velocity before the insertion sequence to the lower energy.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>This is indeed optimal behavior, as
opposed to immediately reducing its energy as a Greedy Best First algorithm using
this heuristic would want to do.” <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";color:black'><o:p> </o:p></span></b></p>

style='mso-tab-count:2'>                        </span><a
href="../cs171-lecture-slides/JMB-A-star-example.pdf">A* Search in Protein
Structure Prediction</a>, Lathrop and Smith, J. Mol. <span class=SpellE>Biol</span>
(<a href="../../../rickl-jmb72.jpg">JMB cover article</a>) <a
href="../../../publications/1996-jmb.pdf">(read full paper)</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";color:black'><span
style='mso-tab-count:3'>                                    </span>Prof.
Lathrop comments, “The A* algorithm found and proved many global optimum
solutions for the difficult and important real-world problem of protein
structure prediction from sequence <u>within two hours</u> in search spaces
sizes as large as 10^20 to 10^30, which are search space sizes totally and
completely inaccessible to blind search methods.”<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span style='mso-tab-count:
2'>                        </span>“<a
href="http://www.boxcar2d.com/">Boxcar 2D</a> <u><span style='background:yellow;
mso-highlight:yellow'>(show initially at the start of class, again at the
mid-class video break, and finally again at the end of class)</span>”<o:p></o:p></u></span></b></p>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span style='mso-tab-count:
3'>                                    </span>The
program learns to build a car using a genetic algorithm. If you let this
program run for a long time (>> 30 generations), you will see that
eventually it produces cars well suited to the terrain.<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span style='mso-tab-count:
3'>                                    </span>This
outcome illustrates a general theme of genetic algorithms: very, very slow;
but, eventually, good performance. After all, it took ~3.6 billion years to
evolve humans from bacteria (<a
href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Timeline_of_evolutionary_history_of_life">http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Timeline_of_evolutionary_history_of_life</a>).<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span style='mso-tab-count:
3'>                                    </span>Please
note that this eventual good performance of genetic algorithms is conditional
upon a representation that allows good solutions to sub-problems to be combined
simply, by cross-over, into a globally good solution; if the vector position of
the features is completely randomized within the chromosome, any such good
performance is lost.<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<h2><a name="_Project:_1"></a><a name="_Projects:"></a><span style='font-size:
12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";color:red'>Project:<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'>Your project is to code
a “Connect-K” agent. </span></b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'><o:p> </o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'><o:p> </o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;background:yellow;
mso-highlight:yellow'>Project Coding Shells:</span></b><b><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'>Student resources are
available <span style='background:fuchsia;mso-highlight:fuchsia'>here</span>,
including:<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span
style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>  </span></span></span><![endif]><b><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'>General documentation and background
info.<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span
style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>  </span></span></span><![endif]><b><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'>A C++ shell.<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span
style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>  </span></span></span><![endif]><b><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'>A Java shell.<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span
style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>  </span></span></span><![endif]><b><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'>A Python shell.<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span
style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>  </span></span></span><![endif]><b><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'>A tournament shell.<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'>We will fix any further
problems and issue new shells as necessary. Please watch for and download any
new shells, then discard your old shells. You can keep any “smart”
code you have written, just put it into the new shells.<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'><span style='mso-tab-count:
1'>            </span>“Dumb”
coding shells are available in C++, Java, and Python.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>You must write the “smarts.”
To help you get started, we also have released the source code to “<span
class=SpellE>RandomAI</span>,” and the executables to <span class=SpellE>RandomAI</span>,
<span class=SpellE>PoorAI</span>, <span class=SpellE>AverageAI</span>, and <span
class=SpellE>GoodAI</span> (they go by different names in different shells).<span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>           </span>Your
final AI will compete in a tournament against all your classmates for extra
credit bonus points (the top 10% will get 10 Bonus points, the second 10% will
get 9, <span class=GramE>the</span> third 10% will get 8, and so on). <span
style='background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>This is a solo or pair project
and you must do all of it all by yourself or with one partner.</span><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'><span style='mso-tab-count:
1'>            </span>As
noted in lecture, all of my CS-171 project shells were written by former CS-171
students (grade of A- or better required) who wanted to go further and do
something creative and interesting. <span style='background:fuchsia;mso-highlight:
fuchsia'>The original Java shell was written by XXXX. The Python shell was
written by XXXX.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>The C++ shell was
written by XXXX, <span class=GramE>then</span> revised by XXXX. The tournament
shell was written by XXXX.</span><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;background:yellow;
mso-highlight:yellow'><o:p> </o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;background:yellow;
mso-highlight:yellow'>Project Deadlines and Regulations:</span></b><b><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpFirst style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo7'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span
style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span></span><![endif]><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'>Project
deadlines are given above in the “<a href="#_Syllabus_Topic_Overview:">Syllabus
Overview and Important Dates</a>” section.<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo7'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol;color:black'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span
style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span></span><![endif]><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";color:black'>Your EEE <span
class=SpellE>DropBox</span> submission must be a single “zipped”
file named “<span class=SpellE>yourLastName_yourUCINumericID_yourTeamName</span>.”<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span><u>NO SPACES OR ANY OTHER SPECIAL UNIX
CHARACTER </u>in <span class=SpellE>yourTeamName</span>. Please restrict your <span
class=SpellE>TeamName</span> to characters, digits, hyphen, and underscore, or
else you may lose points.<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo7'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol;color:black'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span
style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span></span><![endif]><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";color:black'>It should have three
subdirectories: <span class=SpellE>src</span>, bin, & doc; for source,
executable, and documents (<span style='background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>‘doc’
must contain your Project Report</span>).<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpLast style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo7'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol;color:black'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span
style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span></span><![endif]><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";color:black'>Your main AI file must
contain the string “AI” and no other file may contain the string
“AI” (case is ignored, i.e., “<span class=SpellE>ai</span>”
== “AI”).<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'>You will lose 10% of
your project score for each day (or part thereof) that your project is late for
any deadline. Please submit your project early, well ahead of the deadline, and
avoid the last-minute rush. If system problems, web congestion, or other
unavoidable Internet delays make your project late, it is still late and will
be penalized. <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<h2><a name="_Study_Guides_---"></a><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
"Arial","sans-serif";color:red'>Study Guides --- Previous CS-171 Tests:</span><span
class=MsoHyperlink><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
color:windowtext;font-weight:normal;text-decoration:none;text-underline:none'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>Previous
CS-171 Quizzes, Mid-term exams, and Final exams are available here as study
guides.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>As an
incentive to study this material, at least one question from a previous Quiz or
Exam will appear on every new Quiz or Exam. In particular, questions that many
students missed are likely to appear again. If you missed a question, please
study it carefully and learn from your mistake --- so that if it appears again,
you will understand it perfectly.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>Please note
that some of the very old tests below reflect different textbooks that may
define some things differently than does your current textbook. In case of
conflict, your current textbook is deemed correct and will prevail. Some of
your visualization systems may not display the red PDF overlays used to correct
errors in very old tests. For example, in problems #2a, #2c, #3a, and #3b on
Quiz #2 from SQ’2004, the PDF overlay is invisible on a Mac (iPad), and
possibly on some other systems or printers.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>The PDF overlays just do not seem to
work as advertised (sorry!!), but this problem seems only to afflict very old
tests (i.e., from over a decade ago). If you are confused by any of the answers
below, please bring your questions to the TA in Discussion Section
(required).<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>If you find a genuine
error anywhere, please send me email and you will receive a Bonus Point if
correct.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>Also, a
student has recommended ‘quizlet.com’ as a good online study
resource. While I cannot vouch for it, apparently it contains several good
study aids for your textbook.</span> <span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<h2><a name="_Academic_Honesty:"></a><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
"Arial","sans-serif";color:red'>Academic Honesty: </span><span
class=MsoHyperlink><span style='color:windowtext;text-decoration:none;
text-underline:none'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>Academic dishonesty is unacceptable
and will not be tolerated at the University of California, Irvine. It is the responsibility
of each student to be familiar with UCI's current academic honesty policies.
Please take the time to read the current <a
href="http://senate.uci.edu/files/2015/12/Appendix-VIII-UCI-Academic-Senate-Policy-on-Academic-Honesty.pdf">UCI
Academic Senate Policy <span class=GramE>On</span> Academic Integrity</a> and
the <a href="https://www.ics.uci.edu/ugrad/policies/Academic_Honesty.php">ICS
School Policy on Academic Honesty</a>.</span></b></p>

<p><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>The
policies in these documents will be adhered to scrupulously. Any student who
engages in cheating, forgery, dishonest conduct, plagiarism, or collusion in
dishonest activities, will receive an academic evaluation of ``F'' for the
entire course, with a letter of explanation to the student's permanent file.
The <a href="http://www.ics.uci.edu/grad/sao/index.php">ICS Student Affairs
Office</a> will be involved at every step of the process. Dr. Lathrop seeks to
create a level playing field for all students.</span></b></p>
